bug.author: omartin2010
bug.description:
We can see it can be mount but what other modes are accessible? That should be documented. Also, can we give an explicit example of parameter_name ? It seems like it's probably the PipelineParameter name, but I think we should be explicit. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: ce88661d-a489-14f1-717e-4332629f8130 Version Independent ID: 4c01a20c-2346-16f0-edc0-5c3e664b8b66 Content: azureml.pipeline.core.graph.PipelineDataset class - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML-Docset/stable/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-pipeline-core/azureml.pipeline.core.graph.PipelineDataset.yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @j-martens Microsoft Alias: jmartens

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/omartin2010>@omartin2010</denchmark-link> we will review your feedback and get back to you shortly. Thanks.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/omartin2010>@omartin2010</denchmark-link> the document describes <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-pipeline-core/azureml.pipeline.core.graph.pipelinedataset?view=azure-ml-py#parameters>bind_mode</denchmark-link> as " and <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-pipeline-core/azureml.pipeline.core.graph.pipelinedataset?view=azure-ml-py#parameter-name>parameter_name</denchmark-link> as "".

I would have imagined to see it in quotes so that it's clearer. Something like 'accepted values = mount or download'. And for parameter_name to actually point to the documentation of that class with a link to that specific parameter of a Pipeline. We're not making things things obvious the way we are documenting things.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/j-martens>@j-martens</denchmark-link> please review customer's feedback for doc enhancement. Thanks.
Feel free to reach out directly, I’m internal. Cheers
